revised_title: Oblique Refraction of Iceland Crystal: Wollaston's Hypothesis and Observations
tldr: Dr. Wollaston investigates the oblique refraction of Iceland crystal and finds that its refractive properties can be explained by Huygens' theory. He deduces a ratio between the sine of incidence and the sine of refraction and provides a method for constructing a spheroid to model the crystal's refraction. His observations support Huygens' hypothesis, demonstrating the accuracy of the results.
